text.p: Commercial International Bank (CIB) is asking shareholders to choose between fixed or floating rate bonds with maturities of either three, five or seven years, a senior bank official said on Sunday.

The bank said earlier it was proposing to issue Egyptian pound bonds worth 500 million ($150 million) and foreign currency bonds worth the equivalent of 400 million pounds. Shareholders will meet on January 23 to decide on the proposal.
Fatma Lotfy, CIB's general manager for investment, said that under the proposal, the bonds would have a par value of 1,000 pounds or the dollar equivalent.
"These are just proposals...The shareholders will decide on the final nature of the bonds," she said.
Lotfy added that bond coupons would be based on the yield on three-month or six-month treasury bills, currently at 10.029 percent and 10.060 percent respectively.
The last two Egyptian pound bond issues by Cairo-based banks have been at 0.25 percentage points above the yield on six-month treasury bills.
